creator: Joerg-Cyril.Hoehle@t-systems.com
text:
"View results tree" sometimes throws array out of bound exceptions
(see backtrace below).
It then prohibits other listeners below it from gathering data!
Sometimes its root node doesn't open anymore to display individual results.
Work-around: remove node, re-add new. Prior results are obviously lost.

Sometimes there's an empty line amid the tree view, where there should be a
selectable line.
Sometimes even the keyboard cannot be used to navigate the tree
reliably. Moving up moves several up, moving down moves one down (or
vice-versa).

I've been using JMeter 1.9.1 on
OS		display
Solaris		local X
Solaris		MS-Windows via Exceed X server
Suse Linux 9	local X
Suse Linux 8.1	MS-Windows via Exceed X server
MS-windows2k	native

12/04/2003 5:35:09 AM ERROR - jmeter.engine:  
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 400 > 235
	at java.util.Vector.insertElementAt(Vector.java:557)
	at 
javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode.insert(DefaultMutableTreeNode.java:177)
	at 
javax.swing.tree.VariableHeightLayoutCache.createNodeAt(VariableHeightLayoutCach
e.java:763)
	at 
javax.swing.tree.VariableHeightLayoutCache.treeNodesInserted(VariableHeightLayou
tCache.java:473)
	at 
javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicTreeUI$TreeModelHandler.treeNodesInserted(BasicTreeU
I.java:2430)
	at 
javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel.fireTreeNodesInserted(DefaultTreeModel.java:49
7)
	at 
javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel.nodesWereInserted(DefaultTreeModel.java:294)
	at 
javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel.insertNodeInto(DefaultTreeModel.java:223)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.visualizers.ViewResultsFullVisualizer.updateGui(ViewResultsFul
lVisualizer.java:163)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.visualizers.ViewResultsFullVisualizer.add(ViewResultsFullVisua
lizer.java:145)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.reporters.ResultCollector.sendToVisualizer(ResultCollector.jav
a:417)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.reporters.ResultCollector.sampleOccurred(ResultCollector.java:
387)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.threads.ListenerNotifier.notifyListeners(ListenerNotifier.java
:237)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.threads.JMeterThread.notifyListeners(JMeterThread.java:398)
	at org.apache.jmeter.threads.JMeterThread.run(JMeterThread.java:283)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

This looks like a concurrency issue -- which would explain why I've never seen
it inspite being an assiduous "View Results Tree" user: I never use it in
multi-threaded tests.

Can you please confirm this happens only in multi-threaded tests?

I've added a synchronization in the visualizer (in CVS, may take a couple of
days to be in the nighly builds). Can you please check and see if the problem
has stopped occuring?
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text: I'm fairly convinced this is fixed now. Please reopen if it isn't.
